page.title: 13Tourism
page.content: The area is rich in tourism. There are provisions for caravans and tents at some farms. The area is very popular with car owners who are able to drive around on the many country roads and admire the beautiful countryside. There are many public footpaths which criss-cross the moorland and these are used by walkers and ramblers. The North York Moors National Park has a nature trail called The May Beck Trail which meanders its way through the forest taking in much wild life. The area is onlu five miles from Whitby and twenty miles from Scarborough, the largest holiday resort on the Yorkshire Coast. Tourists travel from Whitby and Scarborough mainly during the summer months, to use the tourist facilities provided by the area.
